thread.title: Utah football: Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings heavenly rendition of 'Utah Man'
thread.title_full: Utah football: Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings heavenly rendition of 'Utah Man'

title: Utah football: Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings heavenly rendition of 'Utah Man'
text: Utah football: Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings heavenly rendition of ‘Utah Man’ By BRENNAN SMITH | The Salt Lake Tribune First Published Oct 09 2015 12:12PM • Last Updated Oct 09 2015 12:54 pm (Francisco Kjolseth | The Salt Lake Tribune) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir's Christmas show with special guests Santino Fontana and the "Sesame Street" Muppets, perform at the Conference Center on Thursday night, Dec. 11, 2014. (Francisco Kjolseth | The Salt Lake Tribune) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir's Christmas show with special guests Santino Fontana and the "Sesame Street" Muppets, perform at the Conference Center on Thursday night, Dec. 11, 2014. Share This Article ARTICLE PHOTO GALLERY (3) Renditions of "Utah Man" at Utes games are as commonplace as sacks, touchdowns and red shirts. All renditions, however, are not created equal after the Mormon Tabernacle Choir took a crack at the university's fight song in this Youtube video. The vocals are pristine — dare I say heavenly? — with the video's description reading that the MoTab version will air on ESPN this Saturday ahead of Utah's clash with Cal.
